title: Newsletter 33:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Welcome 2020! Keith discusses New Year resolutions and how a positive attitude can make all the difference. The black sand of "Lake Kennecott" is covered and a New Year's Eve party photo from 1943 shows McGill residents ringing in the new year!
subject: New Year;Kennecott Lake; Cell Towers;McGill Club

title: Newsletter 34:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith analyzes an image of the McGill Pool area and homes for dairy workers. Present-day McGill experiences slightly warmer weather for January. Rudy pushes back the completion date of the IOOF Hall and Mike Nass picks up a 2500 pound safe from Idaho for his collection. A 1907 image showing the excavation of the Reverb building is shown.
subject: Pools;Houses;Safes;Horses;Reverb

title: Newsletter 35:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The first permanent houses to be built in McGill are depicted in an historic image. These were built on the circle . These structures were used as dormitories for the single men who worked in the office. Present-day McGill still experiences warmer weather with no snow. The IOOF Hall is under construction and is slightly behind schedule. A 1909 image of the town is included.
subject: Houses;IOOF Hall;Smoke Stacks

title: Newsletter 36:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The McGill family home is shown before and after the tragic fire that destroyed it on August 28, 1912. Keith tries to determine the exact location of the home. 2020 McGill is still experiencing warmer January weather and minimal snow. A documentary on White Pine county is under way. More wonderful historic images of businesses on Main Street.
subject: Houses;Main Street;Documentaries

title: Newsletter 37:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A film crew arrives in McGill to film for a documentary on White Pine County. The Drug Store, McGill Club and other locals will be featured. Several McGill long-term residents were interviewed. When completed, the documentary will make its debut at an international film festival. Images of the McGill Drug Company and Campton Merc. are displayed as well as a McGill Grammar School commencement announcement from 1925.
subject: Drug Stores;Schools;Documentaries

title: Newsletter 38:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith shares memories about the O'Neil Service Station, owned by Ray and Mary O'Neill. Historical as well as current images of the service station are shown in the newsletter. Present-day McGill experiences a severe wind storm and Marie's Cafe sustains damage.
subject: Main Street;Businesses;Service Stations

title: Newsletter 39:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith analyzes an image of Main Street showing the McGill Candy Store and other businesses. The images appear to be from the 1930's or 1940's. Also shown is the McGill Cleaner's building, the Victory Club and the Greek church. Present-day news shows the IOOF Hall construction coming along nicely.
subject: Main Street;Businesses;Service Stations;IOOF Hall

title: Newsletter 40:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: On September 1, 1929, Ruth beats McGill Community League in baseball with a final score of 20-10. Present-day McGill prepares for the documentary. A 1960 images of Miss Nevada (Nancy Bowen), who happened to be from McGill.
subject: Documentaries;Baseball;Labor Day;Sports

title: Newsletter 41:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Business Ads in McGill - Part I. The Brunswick Billiard Hall, McGill Club, McGill Laundry and Cononelo's Merchandise Store are shown in a vintage image from about 1926. In 2020, the theater remodel is moving forward. A 2909 image showing two men participating in the first 'badger fights' in front of the jeweler and Nye Bros. Outfitters.
subject: Main Street;Automobiles;Men;Nyes Bros;Businesses;Theaters

title: Newsletter 42:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Business Ads in McGill - Part II. Bernstein's Clothes Shop is featured in an ad, as well as the McGill National Bank, McGill Tailoring and Athens Mercantile Co. Present-day shows the theater renovation is continuing with gusto. The McGill Drugstore ribbon-making machine is in full swing!
subject: Main Street;Automobiles;Businesses;Theaters

title: Newsletter 43:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith discusses rationing during WWII and compares to present-day recycling. Every resident (including children) were issued a war ration booklet containing stamps. Rudy continues to work on the theater renovation in present-day McGill and several images are included.
subject: WWII;Theaters;Businesses;Flags;Boarding Houses

title: Newsletter 44:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Images of the original 300 ft. stack are shown. The theater renovation is moving along nicely. Photos from 1935 show the elementary school playground. A great image of the Kennecott mine entrance from the 1950's is included.
subject: Smoke Stacks;Horses;Men;Theaters;Kennecott;Schools

title: Newsletter 45:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Japanese girls perform a traditional dance on the McGill baseball infield. The image appears to be from the early 1900's, perhaps 1916. Many Japanese families lived in McGill in the early days. More images of the theater renovation are included. A 1908 images of the Ruth pit showing railroad tracks and a steam engine.
subject: Sports;Baseball;Churches;Men;Women

title: Newsletter 46:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith includes several images of the McGill Baseball and Football teams from the early 1900's. The IOOF Hall renovation shows floor prepared for new sewer lines.
subject: Sports;Baseball;Men;Women;Football;IOOF Hall;Children;Churches;Schools

title: Small child on car in about 1948 or 1949.
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A small child sits on the roof of a car. The photo is from approximately 1948 or 1949 based on the car. There is a piece of cardboard on the front of the car which shielded the radiator from the cold. The little girl is wearing a dress despite the cold weather.
subject: Children;Automobiles

title: The entrance to the Kennecott mine.
creator: Keith Gibson
description: This image of the mine entrance was taken from the plant side looking down toward the hospital.
subject: Kennecott;Automobiles

title: The construction of the smoke stack.
creator: Keith Gibson
description: This image shows the beginning of construction of the 300 ft smoke stack.
subject: Kennecott;Smoke Stacks;Horses;Men
